  • Lemon chicken stir-fry

Lemon chicken stir-fry

  • Good Food team
Serves 4
Easy
Prep: 20 mins
Cook: 10 mins
A star rating of 4.2 out of 5.160 ratingsRate
113 comments

Who needs takeaways when you can make this low-fat Chinese-style stir-fry in half an hour?

Egg-free
Nut-free
Try our app

Showing items 1 to 3 of 3

Easy egg fried rice
A star rating of 4 out of 5.50 ratings

Sara Buenfeld’s fast and easy fried rice with bacon and vegetables makes for a delicious, versatile supper the whole family will enjoy

  • 2 tsp honey
  • 2 lemons
    juiced
  • 150ml chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 4 chicken breasts
    cut into chunks
  • 1 tbsp cornflour
  • 1 tsp vegetable oil
  • 2 carrots
    finely sliced
  • 1 red pepper
    cut into chunks
  • 140g sugar snap peas

Nutrition: per serving

  • kcal291
  • fat6g
    low
  • saturates0.1g
  • carbs19g
  • sugars15g
  • fibre3g
  • protein38g
  • salt0.95g
Ad
Report Ad

Method

  • step 1

    In a jug, mix together the honey, lemon, stock and soy, then set aside. Toss the chicken in the cornflour so it’s completely coated. Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan, then fry the chicken until it changes colour and starts to become crisp around the edges.

  • step 2

    Add the carrots and red pepper, then fry for 1 min more. Pour the stock into the pan, bring to a simmer, then add the sugar snap peas and bubble everything together for 5-10 mins until the chicken is cooked and the veg are tender. Serve with noodles.

Recipe from Good Food magazine, October 2008

Ad

Rate this recipe

What is your star rating out of 5?

Overall rating

A star rating of 4.2 out of 5.160 ratings

ingevdh

5 months ago
question

What type of soy sauce should I use? Light, dark or Japanese (i.e. the brand that starts with "Ki......").

chris.mcallister00396

6 months ago

Great recipe. Chicken moist and tender. Added my own twist with some red chillies and fresh ginger

are.po69908

6 months ago
tip

Check the chicken after a few minutes so as not to overcook it, otherwise it will be dry.

are.po69908

6 months ago

This is so simple but tasty. I did increase the soy sauce and lemon by 50 percent and added a tablespoon of minced ginger to intensify the flavors since I am eating it with rice. The chicken cooked within four minutes so do not cook it too long otherwise it will be dry.

trelou

7 months ago
question

Absolutely delicious!! Can I ask, is there a reason why cornflour over flour

eileen.darghouth
1 month ago

flour needs to be baked due to e-coli being present in it, cornflour doesn't so it's often used to thicken sauces
